column2: Primary way to group related resources, usually into related business applications
Command-line launched in web browser from Console
Web interface for managing GCP account
Primary way to group resources at the top-level, often around LOBs or org structure
Lists APIs available, with supported versions, and built-in documentation
GCP's solution marketplace; some offered by Google, some by third-party vendors
Hands on cloud training vendor acquired by Google
GCP IaaS that allows you to run virtual machines on Google's global infrastructure
Google Cloud command-line tool
like AWS EC2 spot instances, save money by allowing Google to terminate your instance if resources needed elsewhere
automatically adding or removing Google Compute Engine resources based on load
forwarding traffic from one Compute Engine instance to another within the same VPC network
enable you to share VPC across multiple projects
enable you to interconnect networks across VPCs and projects
a global service that connects user to application using the closest point-of-presence
GCP's managed DNS service, supporting CLI, Console, or API
Google's globally distributed edge caches
Google's managed object store.
finer-grained controls, contain scope (who can perform actions) and the permission (which action can be performed)
Google's managed, high-throughput NoSQL, wide-column database for terabyte applications
Managed RDBMS, including MySQL and PostgresQL
Horizontally scalable managed RDMS with petabytes capacity
Horizontally scalable NoSQL database with SQL-like interface and transactions primarily intended for storing structured data from App Engine apps
Managed relational OLAP database
Google's managed Kubernetes service
Smallest deployable unit (1+ containers) in Kubernetes
Group of replicas of a given Pod in Kubernetes
Kubernetes abstraction for running a group of pods as a network service with a stable endpoint
type of strategy for Kubernetes Deployment that performs a rolling deployment, including maxSurge, maxUnavailable
Google's GKE-based solution for hybrid and multi-cloud systems, including GKE On-Prem and Cloud Interconnect
PaaS for building scalable applications without managing infrastructure, VMs, nor containers
Simpler for of two App Engine environments, providing a free tier, but restrictions (language, binary, request times, no local storage)
Distributed API management for creating and managing API via Console, including generating client libraries and OAuth support
Platform for making API available to partners with analytics, monetization, and developer portal
Fully featured git repositories hosting on GCP, enable IAM-managed access
Create single-purpose functions that respond to events without a server or runtime
Declarative, repeatable deployments of GCP resources written in Python or YAML
GCP's tool for monitoring, logging, error reporting, performance tracing, and debugging
GCP managed Hadoop, based on map-reduce model. (Similar to AWS EMR.)
Managed data pipelines using Compute Engine instances, for purposes like ETL, analytics, and orchestration
GCP's fully managed petabyte-scale data warehouse using SQL
Scalable, reliable topic-based messaging supporting client push and pull
Managed interactive Python environment via Jupyter notebooks
Managed machine learning platform including pretrained and models and support for custom models
Analyze images with RESTful API, classifying into thousands of categories, sentiment analysis, text extraction, etc.
Derive insights from unstructured text using Google machine learning

Translates arbitrary strings between thousands of language pairs
    - Automatically detect language
GCP service that annotates contents of videos, detects scene changes, and flags inappropriate context
